A **kite shield** is a shield that provides moderate SH at a manageable penalty. They are a reasonable choice for both melee and caster characters, at least with a bit of [Shields skill](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)"). While wielding a kite shield, you can [block](/Shields#Blocking "Shields") a maximum of 3 attacks per turn. Only [Spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") are too small to use a kite shield.

## Egos

They can be found with the following [egos](/Ego "Ego"):

- [Reflection](/Reflection "Reflection")
- [Protection](/Protection "Protection")
- [Cold resistance](/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance")
- [Fire resistance](/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")
- [Poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- [Positive energy](/Positive_energy "Positive energy")
- [Resistance](/Resistance_\(ego\) "Resistance (ego)")

Shield egos are relatively rare. Of the egos, reflection and protection are the most common. You can occasionally find cold resistance and fire resistance in [Ice caves](/Ice_cave "Ice cave") and [Volcanos](/Volcano "Volcano"), respectively.

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), shields did not have a maximum number of blocks per turn. Instead, the more blocks you made per turn, the less likely the next block was to be made.
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), kite shields' penalties were negated completely by 15 Shields skill, but their initial penalties were higher.
- Shield penalties increased in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27").
- Kite shields were just called "shields" until [0.25](/0.25 "0.25").

Base shield penalty 10
Maximum Enchantment +5
Grants nothing
Time to Wear 5
Maximum Blocks 3
A piece of wood and metal, to be strapped on one arm for defence. It is cumbersome to wear, and impedes the evasion, spellcasting ability, and attack speed of an unskilled wearer. These penalties will be reduced and eventually eliminated with increased Shields skill.

Egos

  • Cold resistance
  • Fire resistance
  • Poison resistance
  • Positive energy
  • Resistance

Shield egos are relatively rare. Of the egos, reflection and protection are the most common. You can occasionally find cold resistance and fire resistance in Ice caves and Volcanos, respectively.
